home.intro:
Welcome! This is my first ever personal website!
I'm on the path of being a biotechnology data engineer.

bio.title: Bio
bio.intro:
My name is Zhuohe Liu, and I go by Harry if it's easier for you to pronounce my first name as /JOO-oh-her/ instead.
I received the B. S. E. in biomedical engineering from [University of Michigan](#bs1) in 2016, and had my second B. S. E. degree in electrical and computer engineering from Shanghai Jiao Tong University ([UM-SJTU Joint Institute](#bs2)). Later in 2016, I moved to Houston, TX to study at [Rice University](#phd), and got my M.S. in 2020, and Ph.D. in 2022, both in electrical and computer engineering.

phd.title: Doctor of Philosophy
phd.place: [Rice University](https://www.rice.edu/), George R. Brown School of Engineering, Houston, Texas, USA

ms.award1: Trainee Highlight Award: The 7th Annual BRAIN Initiative Investigators Meeting. $400 stipend.

bs2.title: Bachelor of Science in Engineering
bs2.place: [University of Michigan](https://umich.edu/), College of Engineering, Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA
bs2.award2: [James B. Angell Scholar](https://honors.umich.edu/awards.php#angells): Mar. 2016. Awarded to students with four or more consecutive terms of all A's.
bs2.award3: University Honors (4x) and Dean's Honor List (4x): Fall 2014, Winter 2015, Fall 2015, and Winter 2016. Awarded to students with CGPA > 3.5.
bs2.course: Biochemistry, Biomechanics, Quant. Physiology, Quant. Cell Biology, Optoelectronics, Semiconductor Devices, etc.

bs1.award2: Dean's List (3x): Fall 2012, Summer 2013, and Fall 2013. Awarded to students with term GPA > 3.5.
bs1.course: Signals and Systems, Logic Design, Engineering Materials, Modern Physics, Data Mining, etc.

e1.title: Guaduate Research Assistant
e1.place: [St-Pierre Lab](https://www.stpierrelab.com/), Department of Neurosciece, Baylor College of Medicine
e1.bullet1: High-throughput Microscopy Screening Platform for Fluorescent Voltage Biosensor
e1.bullet1-1: Built image analysis pipelines in MATLAB to automate analysis of fluorescence microscopy recordings.
e1.bullet1-2: Designed parallel computing framework to process TBs of data and upload to MongoDB database.
e1.bullet1-3: Crafted advanced UI to visualize high-dimensional data and display statistical analysis results.
e1.bullet1-4: Documented 100+ custom functions and classes in HTML integrated to MATLAB and wrote tutorials.
e1.bullet2: Electrode Motor Assembly as a Microscope Add-on for Electric Field Stimulation
e1.bullet2-1: Built a prototype controlled by a Raspberry Pi to position Pt electrodes to provide stimulation to cells.
e1.bullet2-2: Improved sturdiness and precision using off-the-shelf optomechanical parts and SolidWorks modeling.
e1.bullet2-3: Deployed the redesigned assembly to 2 inverted microscopes and trained 10+ lab members.
e1.bullet3: SPOTlight: A Versatile Single-cell Microscope-based Bioproduct Engineering Platform
e1.bullet3-1: Streamlined automated workflow to control stage position with single-cell precision.
e1.bullet3-2: Achieved at least 1 million fold throughput improvement over well-based screening approaches.

e2.title: Teaching Assistant
e2.place: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, [Rice University](https://www.rice.edu/)
e2.teams: [Dr. Peter J. Varman](https://varman.rice.edu/) (instructor of ELEC326 Digital Logic Design)
e2.bullet1: Graded lab reports and homework on Verilog from undergraduate students.
e2.bullet2: Held lab sessions on FPGA board development.

e3.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
e3.place: [Shea Lab](https://shearesearch.engin.umich.edu/), Department of Biomedical Engineering, [University of Michigan](https://umich.edu/)
e3.bullet1: Developed techniques of bioluminescence living cell microarrays.
e3.bullet2: Studied the time-dependent transcription factor / microRNA activity using R for statistical analysis.
e3.bullet3: Performed plasmid cloning of 110 microRNA to make luciferase reporters.
e3.bullet4: Conducted lentiviruses production and the transfection on target human cells.
e3.skill: Plasmid cloning, Bacterial transformation, Virus production, Lentiviral transfection, DNA Microarray analysis, Bioluminescence and biofluorescence imaging.

e4.title: Laboratory Assistant
e4.place: Student Innovation Center, [UM-SJTU Joint Institute](https://www.ji.sjtu.edu.cn/), Shanghai Jiao Tong University
e4.bullet1: Answered electrical & computer engineering related technical questions for lab users.
e4.bullet2: Maintained lab environment, and managed equipment usage for 300 JI students.

e5.title: Postdoctoral Researcher
e5.place: [St-Pierre Lab](https://www.stpierrelab.com/), Department of Neuroscience, Baylor College of Medicine, Houston, Texas
e5.bullet1: Developed hardware control API to C++ device adapters to enable real-time adaptive microscopy.
e5.bullet2: Adapted computer vision algorithms (e.g. instance segmentation) in Python to accelerate analysis.
e5.bullet3: Assembled a modular microscope and did BOM analysis for commercialization of SPOTlight.
